author: Clarence E Robinson Jr

review: PRO's+ The price!+ Super easy to set up on one's home network+ Easy to get install and use apps for mobile devices or Windows laptopCONS's- My 12Mb/sec DSL connection suffered from lag with this when watching via Chrome Browser on Windows laptop- Chrome Browser extension ONLY for Windows and OSX, not for Android tablet or phone. Seriously?!? I thought Google was cutting edge?- Limited services with mobile apps: Yahoo, Hulu, Netflix, Pandora and Google Play- Minimum requirements not listed ON THE BOX when purchasing- Internet browsing only works with Chrome Browser (of course), but getting Chrome Browser to work on some video sites (i.e. Syfy) took some Google searches to figure it outOVERALL:I can watch TV shows from CBS, ABC, SyFy on the internet via laptop -- with lag -- on this device.No lag with Roku box...going back to that device.I cannot do any browser based viewing from any mobile device.**UPDATE 11/7/13**I just realized all three of my Blu-Ray players also do Yahoo, Netflix, Pandora, Vudu and many, many other streaming services (paid & free). So no need for this device until more services are offered and mobile internet browsers are supported. The only thing I see this being useful for in its current state is when you are traveling and want more control on what your hotel room offers to watch.Because of the devices potential, I left it at a 3star vs. a 2star.
author: Amazon Customer

author: Michael J Russo

review: It works just great for Netflix and YouTube.  I was counting on the promised "cast any Chrome tab from your mobile device".  That is not available at this time.  We decided to watch an amazon prime movie.  I thought that would be no problem as long as I used my computer.  The tab would show up on the TV but the video wasn't supported.  So far it has been a fail for the things I purchased it for.  I am trying to decide whether to return it or wait and see if eventually they will add the features I thought I had been promised to begin with.

review: This does not work with certain versions of Apple's Airport Extreme as well as other routers (See [...] for a list of known router issues).  It is apparently a known issue and is supposedly resolved by rolling firmware on the Airport back to a prior version.  I was unable to get this product to work even after rolling back my firmware. 1/5 stars until I can get it to work.
